result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Alan Ash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Alan Ash in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend count 1 to 961/41(3g)(e).  Court grants motion to amend to misd. 961.41(3g)(e).   DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty.    

Court:  Count 1 - 30 days county jail with credit for 30 days time served to begin on/before 7/15/16 by 3 pm- fine/costs $673.50 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 2 - 30 days county jail consecutive  to count 1 credit for 27 days time served to begin on/before 7/15/16 by 3 pm - fine/costs $673.50 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan

Count 3 - 30 days county jail consecutive to counts 1 and 2  to begin on/before 7/15/16 by 3 pm- fine/costs $579.00  given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan

Acknowledges receipt of information.  Counsel enters NG Plea on felony Count 1.  Counsel requests bond modification from CBS  $1000 to SIBS $5000, state requests some cash bond, Court grants motion  set SIBS $5000  No special conditions.
